indiancalendar

Class IndianFestivals

  • java.lang.Object
    • indiancalendar.IndianFestivals

  • public class IndianFestivals
extends java.lang.Object
    This class calcualtes the Gregorian dates for indian festivals. It contains all indian festivals as a String constants.

    Note: Indian National Calendar follows Purnimanta not Amanta and same is followed here. This class internlly uses other classes for calculations for longitudes of sun and moon for a given point of time. All calculations are made using Date and Calendar APIs that have many parts to improve. These APIs consider the start of time from the Epoch, January 1, 1970 00:00:00.000 GMT (Gregorian). So minimum supported date is January 1, 1970 00:00:00.000 GMT (Gregorian). And if the Java version in less than 1.8 then calculations might have problems. Since 1.8, we have all new improved Date and Time API. All calculations are done for New Delhi, India (location: 28°36'46.2"N 77°13'51.9"E).

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Panchang, RiseAndSet

      • getGregorianDate

        public static java.util.Date getGregorianDate(java.lang.String festivalName,
                                              int gregorianYear)
        Calculates the Gregorian date of a indian festival.
        Parameters:
        festivalName - String constant of the indian festival whose Gregorian date is to be calculated
        gregorianYear - Gregorian Year for which indian festival's Gregorian Date is to be calculated
        Returns:
        Gregorian Date of given indian festival
